attributes.action: provide that persons injured, distressed or subjected to unnecessary pain or suffering during care by the National Health Service may be awarded fair compensation without having to prove negligence on the part of the NHS; to define eligibility for compensation; to establish a Medical Injury Compensation Board and to make other provision for assessment of eligibility and payment of fair compensation.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the present system for handling medical negligence claims against the NHS patients are subjected to years of very adversarial litigation. This system has been created by the legal profession for the legal profession not the injured patients who unwittingly, and ironically, fund it through taxes. Patients injured during care by the NHS should be cared for by the community and not have to suffer the hazards of litigation.
